meanings.definition: To cancel or annul in advance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to precancel her appointment to free up her schedule.
meanings.sent2: The airline allows passengers to precancel their flights for a fee.
meanings.sent3: John precancelled his subscription to avoid any future charges.
meanings.sent4: The team precancelled the event due to bad weather forecasts.
meanings.sent5: By precancelling the order, she avoided unnecessary expenses.

meanings.definition: The act of cancelling or nullifying in advance.
meanings.sent1: Precancelling of the reservation helped avoid any last-minute issues.
meanings.sent2: The precancelling of the contract saved them from future complications.
meanings.sent3: The precancelling of the show tickets left them disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The precancelling of the project was a wise decision in hindsight.
meanings.sent5: His precancelling of the subscription prevented any unwanted charges.
